menu.study-instructions-text:
This study consists of 2 parts.

PART 1 (12’): EXPAND YOUR OL KNOWLEDGE
Imagine you have accessed the platform to expand or refine your understanding of OL.
To do this, you will explore content within the LEARN and GET INSPIRED functions.
Start with LEARN, but then feel free to navigate between functions as you wish.

The goal is not to read as much as possible, but to decide what to explore and how deeply
following your curiosity and interests.

PART 2 (12’): ANALYZE AN OL-RELATED ACTIVITY/RESOURCE
Now, imagine you want to analyze an activity or resource you use or have used,
focusing on the key OL Principles, Perspectives, and Dimensions it addresses.

To do this, you will use the MAP function (though you can return to other functions if needed).
The study concludes when you complete the analysis, download its visual report, and review it.

VERY IMPORTANT: Please always think aloud, commenting on what you’re looking at,
what you’re thinking, what you expect to happen, and any decisions you make.

intro.timeline-2005: OL as "blue" integration of school curricula
intro.timeline-2017: OL as ‘education & culture for sustainability’ innovation
intro.timeline-2022: OL as key leverage for marine citizenship
intro.questions-do-you-want: DO I WANT TO LEARN/TELL ABOUT THE OCEAN?

learn.question-1-principles: How does the Atlantic Ocean exemplify it?
learn.question-1-others: How can it be applied in practice?

map.what-principles: What key principle(s) does your activity/idea ultimately convey?
map.what-perspectives: What key perspective(s) does your activity/idea ultimately convey?
map.what-dimensions: What key dimension(s) does your activity/idea ultimately convey?
map.tooltip-previous-steps: It will unlock once you complete the previous step(s)
map.tooltip-maximum-waves: You can select max 2 waves; to select a new one deselect one of those already selected
map.tooltip-from-angle: Click on ‘FROM WHAT ANGLE?’ to edit
map.placeholder-principles: How does your activity convey that the Ocean is [P-LABEL]?
map.placeholder-perspectives: How does your activity express a [P-LABEL] perspective?
map.placeholder-dimensions: How does your activity enhances people [P-LABEL] the Ocean?
